title: SL Bhyrappa dies at 94: Padma awardee Kannada novelist; PM Modi mourns loss
description: Kannada novelist SL Bhyrappa passed away in Bengaluru due to cardiac arrest. He was 94. Bhyrappa was admitted to Rashtrotthana Hospital. Santeshivara Lingannaiah Bhyrappa was a renowned philosopher and screenwriter. He was born in Hassan, Karnataka. Bheemakaya was his first novel. He authored around 25 novels. Bhyrappa also served as a professor at NCERT, Delhi.

title: ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’: Cabinet approves Rs 69,725 cr for shipbuilding & maritime sector
description: The Union Cabinet, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has approved reforms worth Rs 69,725 crore for the shipbuilding and maritime sector. These reforms encompass financial assistance, a maritime development fund, and a shipbuilding development scheme.

title: 'I feel bad for Pak players': Ex-India pacer's scathing attack
description: Ishant Sharma expressed sympathy for the current Pakistan cricket team, acknowledging the immense pressure they face from fans. He contrasted their situation with the era of Pakistani cricket legends and emphasized India's superior talent pool, infrastructure, and exposure. Sharma highlighted the mental burden on Pakistani players during India-Pakistan matches, noting the constant scrutiny from their supporters.

description: Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, director of an institute in Vasant Kunj, faces a police case after over 15 students alleged sexual harassment. He sent inappropriate messages, made coercive promises, and issued threats. Police have accessed WhatsApp chats, recorded student statements, and seized a luxury car with a fake UN plate.

title: Health risk: Harvard study links deaths to private equity hospital takeovers; cautions India
description: A Harvard Medical School study reveals increased patient death rates in US hospitals acquired by private equity firms due to staffing and salary cuts, particularly in emergency departments and ICUs. Similar studies highlight concerns about quality of care, adverse events, and financial motivations behind these acquisitions, suggesting that healthier hospitals are targeted for cost-cutting measures.

title: 'Dekh lenge': Afridi's warning to Surya ahead of potential India vs Pak final
description: The Asia Cup 2025 could potentially witness a historic India vs Pakistan final, a first in the tournament's history. After India's victory in the Super Four stage, Pakistan kept their hopes alive by defeating Sri Lanka. Shaheen Shah Afridi expressed his team's readiness for a potential final clash, emphasizing their determination to win the Asia Cup.

description: A bombing on the Quetta-bound Jaffar Express in Pakistan's Balochistan province injured at least 12 people, including women and children, marking the latest in a series of attacks on the train since March. The blast, which occurred in the Spizend area of Mastung district, caused six carriages to derail and one to overturn.

Mumbai: Blaze guts Kandivali chawl, 7 critical; Kurla fire damages hutments
description: A fire erupted in a Kandivali East chawl due to a suspected LPG leak, severely injuring seven residents, some with extensive burns. The blaze, which occurred opposite ESIC Hospital, was quickly extinguished. Separately, a smaller fire broke out in Kurla West, affecting several hutments, but no injuries were reported in that incident.

description: The Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP) has requested a judicial probe into the Air India Flight AI 171 crash, alleging a compromised investigation. In a letter to the Civil Aviation Minister, FIP accused the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) of bias and leaking protected cockpit voice recordings, leading to the character assassination of the pilot.

description: Farm associations in Rajasthan's north-western districts have appealed to Prime Minister Modi to halt water flow to Pakistan. They allege that Punjab diverted surplus water to Pakistan between July and September, despite facing shortages in its own canals. This action, according to the associations, threatens farming across 45 lakh acres in Rajasthan, particularly in Sriganganagar and Hanumangarh.

description: Chaitanya Raja, the 42nd titular king of Ettayapuram Samasthanam, led a protest in Thoothukudi demanding removal of ‘false’ portrayals of Ettappa Maharaja in Tamil Nadu Class 10 history textbooks. Supported by locals and political leaders, the protest sparks wider debate on historical accuracy in education.

description: Mike Bezos, father of Amazon's Jeff Bezos, is seeking a CEO for his family office, Aurora Borealis, amidst growing wealth complexities. Based in Miami, Aurora Borealis manages investments, philanthropy, and estate planning. This move signals a shift towards a more institutional structure, mirroring practices of other billionaire families.

Super Typhoon Ragasa: At least 17 dead after Taiwan barrier lake bursts
description: Super Typhoon Ragasa triggered the bursting of a barrier lake in Taiwan's Hualien County, resulting in at least 14 fatalities and 18 injuries. Rescue teams are actively searching for approximately 30 missing individuals after the floodwaters washed away a bridge and inundated a nearby town. Over 7,600 people were evacuated across Taiwan due to the typhoon's impact.

title: Ragging horror in Tamil Nadu: ITI student stripped, hit with slipper
description: In Madurai, three minor boys were booked for ragging a 15-year-old ITI student inside a government hostel. The victim was stripped, humiliated, and beaten, with the assault recorded and circulated online, sparking outrage. Police have arrested the accused, and the hostel warden has been suspended.

title: 55 FIRs, 4 accused & a 2nd autopsy: Zubeen Garg death mystery deepens
description: Following singer Zubeen Garg's death in Singapore, Assam CID has initiated a probe based on multiple FIRs alleging a conspiracy. A special investigation team (SIT) has been formed to investigate the circumstances surrounding his death, with charges including criminal conspiracy and culpable homicide.
